1.text: And the LORD said to Job:

2.text: “Will the faultfinder contend with the Almighty? Let him who argues with God give an answer.”

4.text: “Behold, I am insignificant. How can I reply to You? I place my hand over my mouth.

5.text: I have spoken once, but I have no answer—twice, but I have nothing to add.”

6.text: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind and said:

7.text: “Now brace yourself like a man; I will question you, and you shall inform Me.

8.text: Would you really annul My justice? Would you condemn Me to justify yourself?

9.text: Do you have an arm like God’s? Can you thunder with a voice like His?

10.text: Then adorn yourself with majesty and splendor, and clothe yourself with honor and glory.

11.text: Unleash the fury of your wrath; look on every proud man and bring him low.

12.text: Look on every proud man and humble him; trample the wicked where they stand.

13.text: Bury them together in the dust; imprison them in the grave.

14.text: Then I will confess to you that your own right hand can save you.

15.text: Look at Behemoth, which I made along with you. He feeds on grass like an ox.

16.text: See the strength of his loins and the power in the muscles of his belly.

17.text: His tail sways like a cedar; the sinews of his thighs are tightly knit.

18.text: His bones are tubes of bronze; his limbs are rods of iron.

19.text: He is the foremost of God’s works; only his Maker can draw the sword against him.

20.text: The hills yield him their produce, while all the beasts of the field play nearby.

21.text: He lies under the lotus plants, hidden among the reeds of the marsh.

22.text: The lotus plants conceal him in their shade; the willows of the brook surround him.

23.text: Though the river rages, Behemoth is unafraid; he remains secure, though the Jordan surges to his mouth.

24.text: Can anyone capture him as he looks on, or pierce his nose with a snare?
